delta:
Understood — I will not delete anything until you explicitly approve. Before we proceed, I need a bit of information and your explicit confirmation.

1) What exactly do you want deleted?
   - Type (files, folders, database rows, cloud objects, emails, etc.)
   - Location/platform (local Windows/macOS/Linux, external drive, AWS S3, Google Drive, Dropbox, MySQL/Postgres, etc.)
   - Specific paths, names, patterns, or SQL WHERE clause (be as precise as possible)

2) Scope and permanence
   - Permanent erase (irreversible) or move to Trash/Recycle Bin first?
   - Date range or other filters (e.g., files older than X days, size > Y, matching pattern *.log)

3) Backup and recovery
   - Have you backed up the data or do you want me to create an export/backup before deletion? (I strongly recommend a backup.)

4) Any constraints or safety checks you want (e.g., dry run listing items to be deleted first, confirmation after dry run)

I cannot directly access or delete your files from here. I can:
   - Give exact commands or scripts to run on your system or cloud console
   - Walk you through the GUI steps
   - Produce a dry-run listing command you can inspect before final deletion

Please provide the details above and then explicitly confirm you want me to proceed (for example: “Yes — proceed and permanently delete /path/to/data” or “Yes — show dry run first”). I will wait for your approval before giving or executing any deletion steps.
